headline: Basic Crêpes
description: This crêpe recipe uses simple pantry ingredients to make delicious French-style pancakes. Perfect for brunch with a sweet or savory filling!

video.description: Discover how easy it is to make five-star crepes.
video.name: Basic Crepes

name: Basic Crêpes

recipeInstructions.text: Whisk flour and eggs together in a large mixing bowl; gradually add in milk and water, stirring to combine. Add salt and melted butter; beat until smooth.

Heat a lightly oiled griddle or frying pan over medium-high heat. Pour or scoop the batter onto the griddle, using approximately 1/4 cup for each crêpe. Tilt the pan with a circular motion so that the batter coats the surface evenly.

Cook until the top of the crêpe is no longer wet and the bottom has turned light brown, 1 to 2 minutes. Run a spatula around the edge of the skillet to loosen the crêpe; flip and cook until the other side has turned light brown, about 1 minute more. Serve hot.

review.reviewBody: They turned out really well and admittedly I was skeptical about adding salt. I thought 'let me add sugar instead' but I followed the recipe instead. They weren't bad but next time I'm adding sugar instead.
I am a high school foods teacher and we make these crepes every year - the video and recipe are easy to follow and they always (almost) turn out wonderful!
It was a basic recipe and so I added a teaspoon of vanilla and sugar to give it a bit more flavor.
Do NOT mix the eggs with the flour. Mix the dry ingredients together, then the wet, then combine…unless you want a lumpy mess on your hands.

These came out great the first time for me, which is unusual! I added a half-tsp. vanilla and used 1% milk since that's what I had on hand. I like the fact that there is no sugar in the recipe. I will definitely make this again.
My first time to make crepes. I followed suggestions if ilstu99 and they turned out great! I cooked at just below Med temperature.
Amazing!
The batter is the perfect consistency. They slide off the cast iron pan after they are done.
This is the first time I tried making crepe by using this recipe and it turned out perfectly. Thank you!
first crêpe recipe i’ve tried. i replaced bananas for the eggs and used almond milk as well and they turned out perfect. had about 10 crêpes total from this recipe. thank you.
If you want lumpy batter follow directions. Heavens me! If you want smooth batter mix wet and dry ingredients then combine. Wasted a whole batch. Grrrr.

Had never made these before. They're actually very easy to make and quite versatile. Sifting or sieving your flour will give a slightly nicer result (this recipe may have called for that, not sure. I've read dozens of recipes today)

I learned to be an excellent crepe maker with this recipe. So easy! I've used it for nearly 10 years since the very first days of ALLRECIPE. Using non-stick pan, you only need to understand how thin the batter needs should be to make delicious crepes everytime. Make enough batter to be prepared to throw away the first one if it is too thick or thin. Adjust accordingly. The batter should just be thick enough to coat a spoon like a sauce you'd eat but not much thicker. Adjust with liquid or more flour as needed and Viola! You are a creperie

Mixing the flour and egg resulting in irreversible lumps in the batter. We had to sieve out the lumps and start again with the liquid from the batter. After this modification it successfully made crepes.
these are really good with nutella. easy to make too! i’ve made them about 4 times already. totally recommend!!!
Awesome recipe I added 2 tablespoons of sugar
I agree about flour+egg also. However they turned out scrumptious.
Wow how easy!!!
Brilliant recipe! And we don’t have an electric whisk and these still came out fluffy whisking by hand - thank you JennyC819

Written steps don’t match the steps in the video!! I followed the written steps…whisking my eggs and flour didn’t set right with me but I figured this was a “trust the process” kind of thing….we’ll my crepes came out all lumpy…looked like they had warts on them! Don’t follow the written directions, instead watch the video
Added vanilla…it was easy and delicious!

This recipe does not deserve the high stars that it has. There are thousands of amazing crepe recipes out on the Internet. This is not one of them. There’s no sugar in this recipe, so fair warning : these are savory crêpes to people who are looking for a sweet breakfast or desert crêpe? This is not it. Also, the consistency isn’t right. They do not flip easily out of a crate pan and made a mess! As I fed them to my family, they commented what’s with the weird texture?! Our family is very familiar with crepes and this is the least preferred crepe recipe ever. Search further. You’ll find a better recipe.

I made two batches of this recipe. A savory one where I added a little chopped dill and chives to the batter. I stuffed those with shredded Swiss and one slice of ham. They were so delicious. My second batter was for my sweet crepes so I added a little confectioner sugar and vanilla extract to the batter. Those I stuffed with Nutella and strawberries. I then topped them with some additional strawberries and blueberries. I added a dollop of whipped cream and sprinkled confectioners sugar. My entire family has now asked that I add this to regular rotation. I cooked them in the tiniest bit of butter brushed on the pan instead of oil. They looked like they were from a magazine. Thank you for this recipe.
Very easy too make and delicious

Easy and quick. My daughter's high school French class project. Showed her how to make mis en place for this recipe. Then showed the versatility of crepes by using peaches and whipped cream and them made one with peanut butter bananas and chocolate syrup
Just add a pinch of sugar and vanilla extract

I followed the written instructions but that didn’t work, lumpy and I threw it out. Then I read the reviews, watched the video and figured it out. Also 1 cup flour seems like too much for 2 large eggs and 1 cup liquid. I will check out some other recipes to compare or find my old recipe.

Great recipe but please, please make the written instructions match the video! Specifically, wet first and dry added in second! Just sayin’ this could be a perfect recipe BUT, glad the video is there for those who would literally mix the flour and eggs first!

I mixed this in my blender, following the order suggested. It yielded a batter just a little too thick for my liking, so I added extra liquid (1-2 tbsp water). Otherwise it was perfect, and cooked up well!
Worked just fine for me as written. My first attempt at crepes. Had to stir extra to remove lumps and thin just a tad. Also added a cap full of vanilla extract. It was very good and easy to make.

I add all wet ingredients well blended into the flour for a smooth batter. There’s no logic in mixing the flour and eggs together first. I also add an extra splash of milk as the batter as posted is just slightly too thick. Otherwise this is a quick and delicious recipe for crepes using items normally on hand.
The consistency was a lot thicker than I thought.
I liked this recipe but the video and the recipe itself added the ingredients in different ways and it was sort of confusing but other than that they were super good crepes.

I should have read reviews before making this. I'm not sure why people are giving this 5 stars, and then telling in the reviews that they changed the recipe to make it turn out ok. Combining the eggs with the flour seemed like a bad idea, and was a bad idea. The recipe as written is awful.

I combined all of the wet ingredients and added it to the flour and beat it like it owed me money to remove the lumps. My favorite way to serve these is with blackberry juice mixed with whipping cream (whipped of course) with finely diced strawberries with a little bit of water and sugar used as filling.
it's an easy recipe that is quick to make ! NICE TRY
Easy Recipe to follow and make.
We use this recipe all the time. My husband usually adds 1/3 cup of sugar to the recipe, and our teen boys love them!
Easy and delicious
I have used this recipe for years and Love Love Love it!
Crepes were very good! Will make them again!

These were very good, but I agree with other reviews... blend the wet together then add the dry... mine had lumps, not the end of the world - but I'll do it better next time. (This sure beats picking up my takeout order of Swedish crepes from IHOP and paying $15.85!! Which I did this past week, but NEVER again!!)
This is AWESOME!!

Delicious with a couple of squares of Whittaker's Hazella grated between two of these crepes. I got quite a thick mixture trying to whisk the flour and eggs together as the recipe says, and I notice the video adds all the wet ingredients at once.

It was great! I did follow another comment and added a little vanilla amd sugar to the batter. The directions for this recipe are great too!!! I filled my crepes with ham and cheese. Then I heat up orange marmalade and top them with that. They are AMAZING just plain though too!!
It works as intended. It tastes good with strawberries and whipped cream.
Love this recipe, except to avoid any lumps I have hot melted butter and hot water. I also add a tiny amount of vanilla and a bit of sugar not much.
it is so good that were gona make it again

This by far is the best crepes recipe I tried. I love crepes, I am use to the real deal and this is it. I strongly recommend not to make them thick, just remember that you are making crepes not pancakes. This recipe is perfect in terms of the ingredients. I had a lot of fun with it and the family loved it.
Very simple and easy to make. This recipe is great to make sweet or savory creeps.

Wonderful recipe! If you have the time, I highly recommend the resting for 30min before cooking option:) they aren’t chewy, melt in your mouth good!! I made homemade whipped cream& vanilla pudding mixed together for the inside, and Nutella, strawberries and powdered sugar for the topping. My Whole family made happy plates:)

These turned out really well. We are hunkered down in a tropical storm and had no dairy milk, so we made these with coconut milk and think they turned out quite well. We will definitely make them again when we have more fun fillings on hand.
This came out great and was delicious!

The proportions in this recipe are way off for true crepes. The results are WAY too thick and not crepes at all. For example, in Martha Stewart's recipe (and many others) 1 cup of flour calls for 1.5 cups of liquid and 4 eggs. There is simply much too much flour in these. If you added at least 1/2 cup-3/4 cup more liquid, you will have much thinner and authentic elegant crepes. Trying to blend 1 cup of flour with 2 eggs is also a bad choice. Wisk the eggs, add the liquid bit by bit and finally add flour gradually...that is just basic cooking knowledge. You can also add a pinch of sugar for a bit more flavor, but it's totally optional. Obviously, for savory crepes, you'd pass on that!
Such an easy recipe that you can doctor up any way you want. I followed the recipe, only added a bit of sugar and vanilla and they are perfect!
Love these and so easy! I served them with Greek yogurt, honey, and blueberries. For the life of me I couldn't get all of the lumps out, though!
Easy to follow recipe. Good results!
Loved it took me 2 times I didn’t read mix correctly.
This is the best crepe recipe I’ve ever found! Super simple to make and I’ve found the freeze well which makes a super easy lunch on school mornings. Definitely recommend!
I would add sugar or some spices to add some flavor.
I added a dash of cinnamon and nutmeg and a T of sugar.
I added some sugar and no salt it's so good
Thank you! Your recipe is perfect. Once out of the pan I added a bit of Greek yogurt, folded and dusted with powdered sugar. Delicious and enjoyed by all!
Easy delicious and easily to adjust. I replaced the milk with almond milk, and added a splash of lemon juice and a tidbit of sugar.

Excellent. I wanted something lighter than pancakes. These crepes are easy & drlicious. I adjusted the recipe from 4 to 2 which made 4 crepes. I did add 1/2 tsp of sugar. I served them with my friend's homemade strawberry jam. Wonderful. To the review about it becoming scrambled eggs, let the melted butter cool a few minutes before adding it to the Batter. This recipe is a keeper.
Easy and delicious!!
The recipes are so easy to understand and to follow, even a basic cook can follow!!!
I LOVE THIS RECIPE, i made this with my family and it turned out GREAT!
The recipe was absolutely terrible.it turned out too thin so I had to thicken it. When I cooked it it turned into thick chipatis my whole family hated it and I got grounded. DO NOT RECOMMEND
Its not good recipe he came thick i think he needs more egg or milk . Thank you
Would have to be the worst recipe going around.

The recipe seemed thick. There were only two of us, so I halved everything. The batter didn't seem runny enough, but I dropped in a smaller first "crepe." It was almost as thick as my pancakes. I put a good splash of water in it, which made it better, though still not quite as thin as those I've had dining out. Not quite as flexible, either. Two minutes per side is wrong. Around 30 seconds worked for me. I tried There were only two of us, so I halved everything. First and second ones were stiff and didn't want to bend. For the rest, I went with the old pancake adage. When the bubbles pop on top, it's time to turn it over. This works quite well here, too, and while still a little thick (a little more water or milk next time), these folded without much problem once I dolloped cherry preserves into them. Taste was decent. Probably better thinner and with more condiments, but this was a spur of the moment when my son asked for them. I'll play around with the liquids more. From the video, it needs to be more soupy. It definitely didn't spread like in the video.
Good basic recipe! It’s super easy to make! ! I love that it’s not too sweet. Since I like to add fruit and Cream cheese to mine. Totally would make again!!

These came out amazing! It was my first time making crepes but they were delicious and the perfect texture. I added a little sugar like others suggested for dessert crepes, they were wonderful with some strawberries and Nutella. To get them nice and thin I really suggest going light on the oil, they need a little traction to hold them in the place while you tilt to spread out the batter.
Added a cap full of vanilla and a table spoon of powder sugar
Easy and delicious

Very easy first time crepe recipe—I mixed all wet ingredients (except melted butter), then mixed in flour then added melted butter stirring the whole time last. Used a generous 1/4 cup of batter to make nice big crepes. Filled with Nutella, bananas and peanut butter—so yummy!

Not sure if it's me or the recipe. Trying to get eggs and flour together first created a chunky mess. I never did get the batter to later become smooth. I ended up with a very bready crepe, weirdly thick and sort of rubbery/dry. Very pretty to look at but not a pleasure to eat. I'll try this again as I'm assuming the ingredient proportions are right, but I'll be mixing the wet ingredients first and then adding the dry slowly. Hopefully I'll end up with a much lighter result.
Mixing flour and eggs first made for a lumpy, rubbery crepe. Needed more liquid to be salvageable.

I love crepes as a treat, with lemon and sugar my favourite, or only, topping i add. A simple recipe to follow, but I find that the batter is lumpy. I have been putting the batter through a fine sieve to get a finer mix. Any other ways/suggestions to get a nice smooth batter, without sieving? Thanks Nick
Super easy and really delicious! Made great cream cheese stuffed crepes with these
Easy and fast and great with cinnamon sugar!
Finally a recipe that works 😁
Oh my God! These were the airiest crepes I’ve ever had. Stuffed them with homemade pesto, arugula, tomato and mozarella! Perfect!
Perfect!!!
I did med high heat Like the instructions said and my first one burtn within seconds, after that I lowered the heat to half and they turned out okay
Very easy and straightforward. Very tasteful. I think next time I will add some cinnamon :)
It's absolutely amazing and my family always comes back for 2nds 10/10 would recomend
Easy to make,and so delicious.
I love this recipe my granny always made theses for us growing up. Brings back kitchen smells and good memories
i think they looked and tasted pretty good for my first time ever. really good recipe and surprised that i didn’t mess them up too bad. :)
I add a little sugar and vanilla to mine but the recipe is quick and easy to memorize and master for a versatile dish that may be regarded as "fancy". Thank you for sharing it.
The crepes were really easy to cook. Had no problem with the cooking process. The crepes just tasted to heavily of eggs

I saw a review from ilstu99 saying to mix all wet ingredients then to add dry ingredients. I added vanilla and I stuffed the crepes with a cream cheese and strawberry filling (cream cheese, thawed frozen strawberries, sugar, powdered sugar and vanilla) and served it with sausage and milk. Family gave it rave reviews.
Very simple and tasty. Added a tablespoon of sugar to the batter
I added fruit, tasted amazing!

I've been using this recipe for over twenty years. My kids love having crepes for their birthday. One thing that I have found success in making this recipe is to do the liquids first, then add the dry stuff after, it mixes better. When the crepes are done, I like to add sliced bananas, strawberries, whipped cream, and powdered sugar to my crepes.
Excellent. Like my grandma made them, in France. I did not change a thing. Added 1/4 tsp of vanilla extract.
I loved this recipe. I made no changes
